page.title: 06EDUCATION
page.content:
{Arnside National School
The only primary school is Arnside National School. Before the 1870 Education Act all education in Arnside had been by private subscription. In 1886 the{National Society of the {Church of England}helped to found Arnside National School for all the children of the village. That building stands at the top of Briery Bank and is now a Roman Catholic Church. That building had housed the school until the numbers of children had increased sufficiently to justify the establishment of new premises. In April 1971 a new school was opened in Church Hill. It was designed to accommodate 175 children. At present there are 150 children on roll with 6.8 fully qualified teachers. The headmaster is Mr. I.W. Johnston.
